slideDecks.title: Introduction to Bitcoin
slideDecks.description: A beginner-friendly introduction to Bitcoin covering the basics of what Bitcoin is and why it matters.

slides.title: What is Bitcoin?
slides.body:
Bitcoin is a decentralized digital currency that enables peer-to-peer transactions without the need for intermediaries like banks.

Key characteristics:
• Decentralized
• Borderless
• Censorship-resistant
• Limited supply

slides.title: Why Bitcoin Matters
slides.body:
Bitcoin represents a fundamental shift in how we think about money:

• Financial sovereignty
• Global accessibility
• Store of value
• Programmable money

slides.title: How It Works
slides.body:
Bitcoin uses blockchain technology:

1. Transactions are grouped into blocks
2. Blocks are verified by miners
3. Verified blocks are added to the chain
4. The chain creates an immutable ledger

slides.title: Getting Started
slides.body:
Ready to explore Bitcoin?

• Download a wallet
• Learn about security
• Start with small amounts
• Join the community

slideDecks.title: Vibe Coding for Builder
slideDecks.description: How Builder uses vibe coding, structured content, and AI-powered workflows to deliver Bitcoin education.

slides.title: Vibe Coding for Builder
slides.subtitle: Education-first value for the Bitcoin ecosystem

slides.title: Education Is the Vibe
slides.body:
The fastest way to add value to Bitcoin is through education.

• Every tutorial unlocks new contributors
• Clear guidance reduces onboarding friction
• Shared knowledge compounds into open-source breakthroughs

slides.title: Structured Content Playbook
slides.body:
Structured Content breaks Builder into reusable data blocks that travel anywhere.

• Same facts power web, mobile, email, agents
• Content stays consistent across every surface
• New experiences launch by recomposing what already exists

slides.title: Vibe Planning with ChatGPT
slides.body:
ChatGPT Pro became the vibe planning room.

• Projects feature stores Builder docs for instant recall
• Each conversation outputs structured records
• Ideas are stress-tested with an AI sparring partner before a single commit

slides.title: From Concepts to Structured Data
slides.body:
Every ChatGPT session ends by distilling the insights into JSON blocks.

• Topics, resources, and personas are normalized
• Content stays portable between channels
• Future backends can ingest the same schema without rewrites

slides.title: Building the MVP
slides.body:
Next.js + Vercel host the Builder resource center today.

• GitHub repo connected to Vercel previews for review
• Ship quickly, inspect in temporary environments, merge with confidence
• A content-first MVP that already educates the community

slides.title: Cursor for the Feels
slides.body:
Cursor Pro keeps the flow going anywhere.

• Agents tackle parallel tasks while you stay on strategy
• Mobile web access lets you spin an agent from your phone
• ChatGPT + Cursor co-create features, copy, and refactors

slides.title: Workflow Superpowers
slides.body:
Vibe coding thrives on tight loops.

1. Ideate with ChatGPT Projects
2. Capture structured content immediately
3. Ship updates through Cursor + Vercel previews
4. Review, iterate, and redeploy inside minutes

slides.title: Future Roadmap
slides.body:
Next steps keep the vibe educational and Bitcoin-native.

• Ship a backend to edit content on the fly
• Expose the structured data to other services
• Layer in Lightning, Nostr, and decentralization features as the community grows

slideDecks.title: Welcome to Builder
slideDecks.description: A comprehensive introduction to Builder as a global network, covering what Builder is, why Vancouver is a great Bitcoin builder city (as an example), and what to expect at meetups.

slides.title: Welcome to Builder
slides.subtitle: Building the Future of Bitcoin Together - A Global Network

slides.title: What is Builder?
slides.body:
Builder is a community-driven movement focused on accelerating Bitcoin product development.

We bring together developers, designers, and builders to:
• Learn practical Bitcoin skills
• Share knowledge and tools
• Build real products together
• Foster sovereignty through better UX

slides.title: Our Mission
slides.body:
Accelerate the creation of Bitcoin products by fostering an open, neutral, sovereign, and collaborative builder ecosystem.

We exist to help people build real products on Bitcoin.

We promote practical skills, structured knowledge, and open collaboration.

We believe sovereignty and better tooling go hand in hand.

slides.title: Our Vision
slides.body:
A world where Bitcoin builders have the tools, knowledge, and community to create the next generation of open financial products.

• Every city has a Builder chapter
• Learning Bitcoin feels accessible, structured, and welcoming
• Builders share tools, demos, research, and knowledge openly
• Sovereignty is elevated through better UX and education

slides.title: Our Charter - The Five Pillars
slides.body:
1. Build-First
   We prioritize demos, prototypes, code, and shipping real product experiences.

2. Open, Neutral & Welcoming
   Builder is inclusive, professional, and committed to neutrality.

3. Sovereignty Through Better Tools
   We teach sovereignty as a spectrum, enabled through superior UX and practical tooling.

4. Structured Knowledge & Documentation
   Knowledge must be preserved in structured, reusable formats.

5. Collaborative Community & Participation
   Builder thrives when people share ideas, feedback, and contributions.

slides.title: Our Principles
slides.body:
• No speculation
• No financial advice
• Respectful critique
• Curiosity and openness
• Long-term knowledge creation

slides.title: Our Philosophy
slides.body:
Education
   Start with 101s, build toward mastery, keep content structured.

Design & UX
   Better UX improves sovereignty.

AI & Vibe Coding
   AI assists structured building. All content should be consumable by LLMs.

Community
   We build stronger together through meetups, structured networking, and chapter alignment.

slides.title: Why Vancouver? (An Example)
slides.body:
Vancouver is one of the most Bitcoin-friendly cities in North America.

• Highly active and fast-growing Bitcoin builder city
• Strong Lightning adoption
• Entrepreneurial culture
• Vibrant builder community
• Over 100 Lightning-enabled merchants
• Deep culture of experimentation and sovereignty

This is just one example—Builder chapters exist globally, each contributing to the network.

slides.title: Vancouver's Bitcoin Ecosystem (Example)
slides.body:
Merchant Activity
• 100+ Lightning-enabled merchants
• Strong point-of-sale experimentation
• Local push for Bitcoin-native design

Wallet Ecosystem
• Dominant wallets: Coinos, Phoenix, Muun, Zeus
• Active node communities
• Growing self-custody adoption

Notable Builders
• Coinos Team - Lightning backend powering hundreds of merchants
• Builder Vancouver Crew - Building structured product-focused community

Similar ecosystems exist in Builder chapters worldwide.

slides.title: Builder City Scores
slides.body:
Vancouver's Bitcoin Builder Metrics:

• Sovereignty: 8/10
• Builder Density: 7/10
• Merchant Activity: 9/10
• Innovation Energy: 8/10
• Regulatory Support: 6/10
• Global Visibility: 6/10

slides.title: Why Vancouver is Great for Bitcoin
slides.body:
Economic Strengths
• High-tech workforce
• Strong startup community
• Gateway city for global talent

Tech Ecosystem
• Deep engineering talent pool
• Strong AI presence
• High adoption of decentralized tools (Umbrel, Start9)

Quality of Builders
• Ex-Amazon, Ex-Microsoft, Web3 refugees
• Local Bitcoin-first companies
• University pipelines: UBC, SFU, BCIT

Infrastructure
• High-quality WiFi
• Excellent co-working spaces
• Conference venues available

slides.title: Meetup Format
slides.body:
Our meetups typically run 2-3 hours and include:

• Presentations
• Hands-on activities
• Networking
• Open discussion

We start with introductions, followed by the main content, and end with open discussion and collaboration time.

slides.title: Typical Schedule
slides.body:
6:00 PM - Doors open, networking
6:30 PM - Welcome and introductions
6:45 PM - Main presentation or workshop
7:45 PM - Break
8:00 PM - Open discussion / hands-on time
8:30 PM - Wrap up

slides.title: What to Bring
slides.body:
Yourself and your curiosity!

For workshop sessions:
• Laptop
• Bitcoin wallet (mobile or hardware) - optional but useful

We'll provide any other materials needed.

slides.title: Atmosphere
slides.body:
Expect a casual, friendly environment focused on learning and building.

• People are genuinely excited to share knowledge
• Questions are encouraged
• Learning is collaborative
• All skill levels welcome
• Don't be shy - introduce yourself and ask questions!

slides.title: How to Get Started
slides.body:
Before your first meetup:
• Review our Bitcoin 101 guide
• Check out What to Expect page
• No preparation required - just bring curiosity!

Join our community:
• Follow us on social media
• Subscribe to our newsletter
• Join community channels
• Attend upcoming events

slides.title: Stay Connected
slides.body:
Website: builder.van
Twitter: @builder_van

Join us for:
• Monthly meetups
• Technical presentations
• Hands-on workshops
• Collaborative building sessions
• Networking with fellow builders
